intro: Anthochortus ecklonii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is well adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen throughout the year. Anthochortus ecklonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
